channel.title: Safer Choice
channel.description: Updated Safer Choice content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: FY 2017 Center of Excellence for Chemical Alternatives Assessment Request for Applications
item.description:
The Office of Pollution Preventions and Toxics (OPPT) is soliciting applications from eligible entities for an Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) cooperative agreement to create a Center of Excellence for Chemical Alternatives Assessment to promote chemical safety and informed chemical substitution.

Applications are due by January 17, 2017, 11:59 pm, (ET). EPA will receive applications electronically through Grants.gov. Please refer to Section IV for full information on the submission process. Applications must be submitted on time in order to be considered for funding.

  • FY17 AA Center application (PDF)(25 pp, 174 K)
item.dc:creator: tshorter

item.title: Request for Grant Applications to Identify Safer Chemical Alternatives
item.description:
We are soliciting applications from eligible recipients for a four-year cooperative agreement to create a new Center of Excellence for Chemical Alternatives Assessment to promote chemical safety and informed chemical substitution. EPA expects to award up to approximately $800,000.

The center would establish and deploy expertise to identify and evaluate the safety and functionality of chemical alternatives for products and processes. It would provide information and assistance to state, local, and tribal government agencies, industry, and others about safer chemicals or processes. This will minimize unintended, adverse consequences when making chemical substitution decisions.

The cooperative agreement will be issued and managed through EPA’s Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics. The amount of grant funding released each year is dependent upon congressional appropriation and the quality of applications received.

Quick facts

  • Eligibility: U.S. state and local governments, U.S. territories and possessions, federally recognized Indian tribal governments and intertribal consortia of federally recognized tribes, universities and colleges, and private and public nonprofit institutions.
  • Review of proposals: Only eligible applicants with applications that meet the threshold criteria in Section III of the Request for Applications (RFA) will be reviewed based upon the evaluation criterion provided in Section V. 
  • Amount of award: EPA anticipates awarding approximately $800,000 under this competitive announcement. EPA intends to make one award to a U. S. organization or group, and the award is expected to be in the range of $800,000, issued over a four-year funding period.

FY 2017 Center of Excellence for Chemical Alternatives Assessment Request for Applications. The application period will close on January, 17, 2017, 11:59 pm (EDT).

This notice is published under the Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance (CFDA) 66.716.
item.dc:creator: tshorter

item.title: Safer Choice Partner and Stakeholder Summit 2016 - Agenda and Presentations
item.description:
The second annual Safer Choice Partner and Stakeholder Summit took place November 15-16, 2016 in Washington, D.C. The agenda and presentation slides for both days are available below.

  • Second Annual Safer Choice Summit Agenda (PDF)(6 pp, 235 K, November 14, 2016)
  • Second Annual Safer Choice Summit Presentation Slides (PDF)(102 pp, 7 MB, November 22, 2016)
item.dc:creator: lisa_mayo

item.title: Safer Choice Partner and Stakeholder Summit 2016
item.description:
Thank you to all who attended the second annual Safer Choice Partner and Stakeholder Summit! The Summit explored topics of importance to stakeholders and the program, and facilitated dialogue geared towards continuing to improve the program, advance safer chemistry, and increase awareness of the new Safer Choice label.

Agenda and Presentations

  • View the agenda for the 2016 Safer Choice Summit.
  • View presentation slides.

About the Summit

The second annual Safer Choice Partner and Stakeholder Summit took place November 15-16, 2016 in Washington, D.C. and built off of the momentum of the first Summit in 2015.

Attendees included:

  • Safer Choice Partners
  • Purchasers
  • Retailers
  • NGOs
  • Trade Associations
  • Chemical Manufacturers
  • Other interested stakeholders
item.dc:creator: lisa_mayo

item.title: Safer Choice Fact Sheets
item.description:
These fact sheets provide information and guidance on the Safer Choice program for consumers, as well as resources for schools, communities and municipalities, and manufacturers.

  • Safer Choice Fact Sheet - Schools (PDF)(1 pg, 215 K)
  • Safer Choice Fact Sheet - Communities and Municipalities (PDF)(1 pg, 140 K)
  • Safer Choice Fact Sheet - Fragrance-Free (PDF)(1 pg, 258 K)
  • Safer Choice Fact Sheet - Resources for Manufacturers (PDF)(2 pp, 351 K)
  • Safer Choice Fact Sheet - General Consumer (PDF)(1 pg, 165 K)
item.dc:creator: lisa_mayo

item.title: Safer Choice Partner of the Year Awards Ceremony Video Gallery
item.description:
The 2016 Safer Choice Partner of the Year Awards Ceremony was held on May 9, 2016 in Washington, DC. EPA honored 24 organizations with Partner of the Year Awards for actively advancing the goal of chemical safety through exemplary participation in, or promotion of, Safer Choice. Read more about the 2016 Partner of the Year Award winners.

Below, watch as seven Partner of the Year Award winners talk about sustainability, safer chemicals and what it means for them to be a Safer Choice Partner.

The following links exit the site Exit

Boulder Clean

CEO Steve Savage discusses how the Safer Choice program has helped Boulder Clean accomplish its goal of offering products that are safer for people, homes, and the planet.

Clean Control Corporation

Clean Control Corporation discusses how the Safer Choice program has helped them to achieve their sustainability goals.

The Clorox Company

CEO Benno Dorer shares the story of how the Clorox Company developed its Safer Choice-labeled Green Works products.

Futurescape Inc.

CEO Ira Wendorf discusses his motivation for developing an environmentally safer product with the backing of an authoritative source like EPA.

Jelmar, LLC

CEO Alison Gutterman discusses reformulating Jelmar products to qualify for the Safer Choice label without compromising performance.

Osprey Biotechnics, Inc.

Osprey Biotechnics discusses how the Safer Choice label helps them educate consumers about safer products and offer them sustainable options.

Solutex, Inc.

Solutex discusses how the Safer Choice program has enabled their team and their customers to be more educated on the benefits of using products with safer chemical ingredients.
item.dc:creator: lisa_mayo

item.title: Safer Choice Criteria for Defoamers
item.description:
Safer Choice reviews all ingredients in products qualified to carry the label, including antifoaming agents or defoamers. For Safer Choice review, the structure and chemistry of a particular defoamer will determine the appropriate criteria by which it will be evaluated. For example, a polyethylene/polypropylene glycol ether-based defoamer will be evaluated against the Surfactants Criteria if it has surfactant properties, while a polyacrylate or silicone-based defoamer would most likely be evaluated against the Polymer Criteria. Defoamers that do not fit into a specific functional class as defined by Safer Choice criteria will be evaluated against the Master Criteria.

A defoamer is a chemical additive used to remove or hinder the formation of foam. Foaming occurs when some detergents are used with mechanical agitation. Defoamers are used in a variety of products where foaming may interfere with product or equipment performance, such as in dishwasher detergents and industrial process liquids.
item.dc:creator: lisa_mayo
